es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel.flow
Interface Flow

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<SimulationObject>, Flow, Identifiable, SimulationObject
All Known Subinterfaces:
FinalizerFlow, InitializerFlow, JoinFlow, SplitFlow, TaskFlow
public interface Flow
extends Flow

The process an element has to carry out.

A flow is structured in a graph, so it can have successors and predecessor. One or several successors to this flow can be added by using link. If this flow is added as a successor for another flow, addPredecessor is invoked too. Having one or several successors implies implementing Sequence (WFP1)

Flows can have not only successors and predecessors, but can be enclosed by an structured flow, which is considered its parent.

This flow can be requested to be carried out by an element. To do this, a set of user-defined conditions are first checked by invoking beforeRequest. If this method is true, the Element can definitely request this flow.

Author:
Iván Castilla Rodríguez

Method Detail

request

void request(WorkThread wThread)
Requests this flow. An element, by means of a work thread, requests this flow to carry it out.

Parameters:
wThread - The work thread requesting this flow.

next

void next(WorkThread wThread)
Requests this flow successor(s) to continue the execution. This method is invoked after all the tasks associated to this flow has been successfully carried out.

Parameters:
wThread - The work thread which requested this flow.
